lines.text:
[Repeated line looking at pretty Paula]
Pretty girl for a white woman!
Like a piece of cheese the rats have been at.

[after being tightly hugged after seeing Jonny for the first time in a long time]
Oh, my goodness, Jonny!
How is your goodness these days?

[Repeated line looking at pretty Paula]
Pretty girl for a white woman!
Yeah! YOU'RE pretty in any language!
Well, I love men.
So does Johnny... one at a time. If he keeps his health, he'll get around to everybody.
Why didn't you tell me, Jonny?
Because I don't put anything in the paper until I've heard it twice and seen it three times.
Oh, listen, Jonny. Everyone's not like you. You'd rather be a good reporter than... Shakespeare.
Shakespeare was a reporter. Scooped Queen Elizabeth. That's the thing to do with dames. Scoop 'em, but stay away from all of them.
Aye, we can duck your words but can you duck our bullets?
I can try.
A two-timer, huh? She isn't a woman. She's a football.
Is that a flag you're waving or the double standard?
When a man's a two timer, that's just normal, but if a woman's a two timer, that's strong drink and shouldn't be sold to minors.
I ought to poke you one.
What for? If you can't read the book, then someone has to do it for you? You want me to spell out the word?
Spell away!
It rhymes with tramp but means the opposite.
Name's Paula - a great girl. Saw a lot of her before I left.
You never told me about her.
Do I have to tell you everything?
Not a bad idea. Anybody I know?
And nobody you owe either.
I want to marry her, Jonny.
No foolin'?
That's it exactly. No foolin'.
You think it's big important stuff, huh?

[Kirk shakes his head affirmedly]
And the babe, likewise?
From her letters I'd say yes.
It wasn't all set up before you left?
Not quite, but this six months apart made it right.
Six months? If it took you that long to make up your mind, it's no good. Nothing will come of it.
How do you know? Nothing ever lasted six months with you - not even the seven year itch.
Maybe so, Junior, but when I meet the ultimate babe, I'll know it...
[He snaps his fingers]
... like that!

[Flirting at bar]
Like what you see?

[Condescendingly]
Sure, you're as pretty as a picture in a fifty-cent magazine.
Kirk darling, you... you look wonderful!
Aw you look good enough to eat, which isn't such a bad idea
[Kirk embraces, then kisses Paula]
